name: df-er
body: |- wb(wer(c0, c1), w3a(wrel(c0), wceq(cdm(c0), c1), wss(cun(ccnv(c0), ccom(c0, c0)), c0)))
comment: Define the equivalence relation predicate. Our notation is not standard. A formal notation doesn't seem to exist in the literature; instead only informal English tends to be used. The present definition, although somewhat cryptic, nicely avoids dummy variables. In ~ dfer2 we derive a more typical definition. We show that an equivalence relation is reflexive, symmetric, and transitive in ~ erref , ~ ersymb , and ~ ertr . (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-1995.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Nov-2015.)
